com.tomzhu.tree

Class BasicTreeNode<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomzhu.tree.TreeNode<E>
      • com.tomzhu.tree.BasicTreeNode<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of element

    public class BasicTreeNode<E>
extends TreeNode<E>
    a tree node implementation for basicTree. it holds a children chain.
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    tomzhu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicTreeNode(E value)
      create a basicTreeNode with given value and without children , sibling , parent.
      BasicTreeNode(E value, BasicTreeNode<E> parent)
      create a basicTreeNode with given value and parent.
      BasicTreeNode(E value, BasicTreeNode<E> parent, BasicTreeNode<E> firstChild)
      create a basicTreeNode with given value, parent, first child
      BasicTreeNode(E value, BasicTreeNode<E> parent, BasicTreeNode<E> leftSibling, BasicTreeNode<E> rightSibling, BasicTreeNode firstChild)
      create a basicTreeNode with specific value , parent node , left sibling node , right sibling node , and first child node

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node)
      add the node as child to current node and returned the added node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(E value)
      create a new node using the specific value and add it to the current node as child then return the added node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(int i, BasicTreeNode<E> node)
      add a child node to the current node in specific location i which is left from right and start at 0.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(int i, E value)
      add a child node to the current node using specific value in specific location i which is left from right and start at 0.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChildren(BasicTreeNode<E>[] nodes)
      add the nodes to the current node as children and return the current node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChildren(E[] values)
      create nodes using values and add the nodes to the current node as children , then return the current node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addLeftSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node)
      add the parameter node to the current node as it's left sibling.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addLeftSibling(E value)
      create a new BasicTreeNode using the specific value and add it to the current node as it's left sibling.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addRightSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node)
      add the parameter node to the current node as it's right sibling.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addRightSibling(E value)
      create a new basicTreeNode using the current value and add it to the current node as it's right sibling.

      remove all children nodes and return the current node.

      • getChilds

        public BasicTreeNode<E>[] getChilds(boolean leftToRight)
        Specified by:
        getChilds in class TreeNode<E>
        Parameters:
        leftToRight - whether left to right.
        Returns:
        the children as array of the current node, which the order is based on the parameter leftToRight , if it is true , then the order is left to right, otherwise inverted.

      • getChild

        public BasicTreeNode<E> getChild(int i)
        get the i-th child of the current node. return null if the index i is beyond the size. the support index is like array from 0 to (children size - 1).
        Parameters:
        i -
        Returns:
        the i-th child of current node

      • containChild

        public boolean containChild(BasicTreeNode<E> child)
        check whether the node has the specific child node child, if yes, return true, otherwise return false. a simple method is just checking child.parent == this , although user can use this strategy for simplify and performance , the child will not be added to the parent because user can call child.parent = this.
        Parameters:
        child -
        Returns:

      • searchChild

        public int searchChild(BasicTreeNode<E> child)
        search the child node , when find a node then return the found child's location, otherwise return -1;
        Parameters:
        child -
        Returns:

      • removeLastChild

        public BasicTreeNode<E> removeLastChild()
                                 throws MyNosuchElementException
        remove the last child of the current node from left to right. then return the removed child. if the current node doesn't have children, throw MyNosuchElementException
        Returns:
        the removed child
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • removeFirstChild

        public BasicTreeNode<E> removeFirstChild()
                                  throws MyNosuchElementException
        remove the first child of the current node from left to right. then return the remove child and if the current node doesn't have children, throw MyNosuchElementException
        Returns:
        the removed first child
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • removeChild

        public BasicTreeNode<E> removeChild(int i)
                             throws MyNosuchElementException
        remove the specific child at location i and return the removed node. if the location i is not reliable, then throw MyNosuchElementException
        Parameters:
        i -
        Returns:
        the removed i-th child.
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • removeChild

        public BasicTreeNode<E> removeChild(BasicTreeNode<E> child)
                             throws MyNosuchElementException
        remove the child node child. but when the child is not the child of the current node, return null, otherwise return the remove child. MyNosuchElementException is not possible to throw.
        Parameters:
        child -
        Returns:
        the removed child
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • clearChildren

        public BasicTreeNode<E> clearChildren()
        remove all children nodes and return the current node.
        Returns:
        the current node.
